sen.j: 織田長純（おだ ながずみ、安政3年10月25日 (旧暦)（1856年11月22日） - 大正9年（1920年）11月29日）は、日本の華族。
sen.e: Nagazumi ODA (November 22, 1856-November 29, 1920) was a Japanese peer.
Nagazumi ODA (November 22, 1856-November 29, 1920) was a Japanese peer.
Nagazumi ODA (November 22, 1856 - November 29, 1920) was a Japanese peer.

sen.j: 大和国芝村藩主織田長易の三男。
sen.e: He was born the third son of Nagayasu ODA, the lord of the Shibamura Domain in Yamato Province.
He was born as the third son of Nagayasu ODA, the lord of the Shibamura Domain in Yamato Province.
sen.cmt: the thirdの前にasを挿入しました。
sen.e: He was born as the third son of Nagayasu ODA, the lord of the Shibamura Domain in Yamato Province.
His real mother was Hama.
His real mother was Hama.
His real mother was Hama.
His common name was 'Tokujiro.'
His common name was Tokujiro.
His common name was Tokujiro.
His court rank was Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
His court rank was Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
His court rank was Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank).
His title was viscount.
His title was viscount.
His title was viscount.
He was born on November 22, 1856.
He was born on November 22, 1856.
He was born on November 22, 1856.

sen.j: 明治13年（1880年）7月22日、家督を相続する。
sen.e: He succeeded the head of the family on July 22, 1880.
He succeeded the family estate on July 22, 1880.
sen.cmt: 家督をfamily estateに変更しました。
sen.e: He succeeded the family estate on July 22, 1880.

sen.j: 明治17年（1884年）7月8日、子爵となる。
sen.e: He was created viscount on July 8, 1884.
He was created viscount on July 8, 1884.
He was created viscount on July 8, 1884.

sen.j: 同年8月12日、従五位に叙任される。
sen.e: He was created Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) on August 12, 1884.
He was created Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) on August 12, 1884.
He was created Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) on August 12, 1884.

sen.j: 後に正三位にまで昇進する。
sen.e: He was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) later.
He was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) later.
He was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) later.

sen.j: 明治18年（1885年）4月24日、宮中祇候に就任し、明治天皇に奉仕する。
sen.e: On April 24, 1885, he held the post of Kyuchu Shiko (a retainer of the Imperial court) and served Emperor Meiji.
On April 24, 1885, he held the post of Kyuchu Shiko (a retainer of the Imperial court) and served the Emperor Meiji.
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。
sen.e: On April 24, 1885, he held the post of Kyuchu Shiko (a retainer of the Imperial court) and served the Emperor Meiji.

sen.j: 同年7月7日、宮中祇候の廃止にともなって免職される。
sen.e: Upon the abolition of Kiyuchu Shiko on July 7, 1885, he was dismissed.
Upon the abolition of Kyuchu Shiko on July 7, 1885, he was dismissed.
sen.cmt: Kyuchuの誤字を訂正しました。
sen.e: Upon the abolition of Kyuchu Shiko on July 7, 1885, he was dismissed.

sen.j: 明治18年（1885年）7月21日、宮中の賢所勤番を命じられる。
sen.e: On July 21, 1885, he was assigned to Kinban (a sentry) of Kashiko Dokoro (Palace Sanctuary) in the Imperial Palace.
On July 21, 1885, he was assigned to Kinban (a sentry) of Kashiko Dokoro (Palace Sanctuary) in the Imperial Palace.
On July 21, 1885, he was assigned to Kinban (a sentry) of Kashiko Dokoro (Palace Sanctuary) in the Imperial Palace.

sen.j: 明治19年（1886年）2月5日、賢所勤番の廃止にともなって免職される。
sen.e: Upon the abolition of Kinban of Kashiko Dokoro on February 5, 1886, he was dismissed.
Upon the abolition of Kinban of Kashiko Dokoro on February 5, 1886, he was dismissed.
Upon the abolition of Kinban of Kashiko Dokoro on February 5, 1886, he was dismissed.

sen.j: なお、墓碑によれば、「平生多病晩年養痾」とあり、健康に恵まれなかったようである。
sen.e: From the phrase "Annoyed by various sicknesses in his lifetime until last days" featured in his tombstone, it is speculated that he was not endowed good health.
From the phrase "Annoyed by various sicknesses in his lifetime until last days" featured in his tombstone, it is speculated that he was not endowed good health.
From the phrase "Annoyed by various sicknesses in his lifetime until last days" featured in his tombstone, it is speculated that he was not endowed good health.
He passed away on November 29, 1920.
He died on November 29, 1920.
sen.cmt: passed awayでなく、diedに訂正しました。この文書ではそのほうが適切かと思われます。
sen.e: He died on November 29, 1920.

sen.j: 夫人、子女ともにいない。
sen.e: He had no spouse and real children.
He had no spouse and real children.
He had no spouse and real children.

sen.j: 養子は織田長義（弟織田長表の長男）。
sen.e: His adopted son was Naganori ODA (the eldest son of Nagasue ODA, Nagazumi's younger brother).
His adopted son was Naganori ODA (the eldest son of Nagasue ODA, Nagazumi's younger brother).
His adopted son was Naganori ODA (the eldest son of Nagasue ODA, Nagazumi's younger brother).
